intro: Genista harveyi, commonly known as Harvey's broom, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its adaptability to arid environments makes it a resilient species in its native range.
